intro: Triphora trianthophoros f. albidoflava, commonly known as the white-flowered triphora, is a unique flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, bloom in summer and are known for their fragrance. The foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
